member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.KeysightAttributeString
member.summary: Defines a list of standard (native) VISA C string attributes and Keysight-specific VISA C attributes. The value assigned to each member matches the value assigned to the corresponding VISA C attribute.

remarks.para: Use this enumeration to supply legal values to the GetAttributeString method defined in the interface. All session classes derive from this interface, and so may be cast to this interface. There are several overloads of the method in this interface. To minimize the potential for error, Keysight recommends using the overload that uses this enumeration.

member.name: F:Keysight.Visa.KeysightAttributeString.KeysightIOLibrariesPath
member.summary: A Keysight-specific VISA read-only attribute with value 0x0fff003c (VI_AGATTR_IOLIBRARIES_DIR). This VISA C resource manager attribute cannot be accessed directly - use the corresponding property instead.

member.name: F:Keysight.Visa.KeysightAttributeString.KeysightIOLibrariesRegistryKey
member.summary: A Keysight-specific VISA read-only attribute with value 0x0fff003d (VI_AGATTR_IOLIBRARIES_REG_PATH). This VISA C resource manager attribute cannot be accessed directly - use the corresponding property instead.

member.name: F:Keysight.Visa.KeysightAttributeString.KeysightInterfaceSerialNumber
member.summary: A Keysight-specific VISA read-only attribute with value 0x0fff0045 (VI_AGATTR_INTFC_SERIALNUMBER). Use with for GPIB Interface sessions. There is no corresponding VISA.NET property. If the interface does not have a serial number it returns an empty string.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.KeysightAttributeInt32
member.summary: Defines a list of standard (native) VISA C 32-bit integer attributes and Keysight-specific VISA C attributes. The value assigned to each member matches the value assigned to the corresponding VISA C attribute.

remarks.para: Use this enumeration to supply legal values to the GetAttributeInt32 method defined in the interface. All session classes derive from this interface, and so may be cast to this interface. There are several overloads of the method in this interface. To minimize the potential for error, Keysight recommends using the overload that uses this enumeration.

member.summary: A Keysight-specific read/write VISA attribute with value 0x0fff0028 (VI_AGATTR_GPIB_T1_DELAY). Use with and and GPIB Interface sessions. This attribute allows setting and getting the T1 delay for the interface; it can be between 350 and 2400 nanoseconds, inclusive.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.KeysightVisaEventArgs
member.summary:
Provides additional data about a Keysight VISA event.
This class inherits from to allow programs to access information about events that may not be explicitly defined in this interface.
For more information, see Hardware Events.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.KeysightVisaEventArgs.#ctor(Ivi.Visa.VisaEventArgs,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Base event arguments from the VISA event.
A VISA context handle of the event.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.KeysightVisaEventArgs.Dispose
member.summary: Performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this event arguments object, but only if another thread has not already started to dispose of the object.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.KeysightVisaEventArgs.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this session, but only if another thread has not already started to dispose of this object.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.KeysightVisaEventArgs.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Throws an exception if the object is already disposed.

member.param: A constant that identifies a VISA standard attribute. The type of the attribute must be unsigned byte.
member.returns: The value of the attribute.

member.summary: Retrieves the value of the specified attribute from the native C implementation.
member.param: A constant that identifies a VISA standard or vendor-defined attribute. The type of the attribute must be unsigned byte.
member.returns: The value of the attribute.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all GPIB INTFC sessions.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession
member.summary: An abstract class inherited by all VISA.NET session classes. VisaSession includes common functionality for all VISA.NET sessions, including general information about the implementation, information about the device to which the session is connected, event management, locks, and the ability to generically access features of the underlying VISA implementation.

remarks.para: The VisaSession class must derive from IKeysightNativeVisaSession because Keysight VISA.NET sessions delegate their work to Keysight VISA. IKeysightNativeVisaSession allows limited access to underlying VISA features, primarily undocumented attributes.
The VisaSession class must derive from IDisposable because it must be able to dispose of unmanaged resources including the corresponding sessions in the underlying VISA C implementation.

Although it is technically possible, Keysight recomends that customers not derive custom classes from this class. Attempts to override some methods may result in a stack overflow when the method is called.
For more information, see Resources and Sessions.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.IKeysightNativeVisaSession

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.#ctor(Keysight.Visa.SessionType,System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the common features of a new instance of a VISA.NET session class to communicate with the specified device.
member.param: The type of the instantiable, derived session class that is calling this constructor.
The name (VISA address) of the device with which this session will communicate.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is ignored by Keysight VISA.NET. Both modes may be specified. The default is None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.#ctor(Keysight.Visa.SessionType,System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes the common features of a new instance of a VISA.NET session class to communicate with the specified device.
member.param: The type of the instantiable, derived session class that is calling this constructor.
The name (VISA address) of the device with which this session will communicate.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is ignored by Keysight VISA.NET. Both modes may be specified. The default is None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to IO Libraries Connection Expert documentation for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered in Keysight Connection Expert, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, Open does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.DisableEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType)
member.summary: Disables a calling program's ability to receive events of the type specified by the argument using a VisaSession.WaitOnEvent method (any overload).
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET. If eventType is EventType.AllEnabled the session stops receiving all events.

remarks.para: This method prevents new events from being added to the event queue(s). However, event occurrences already in the queue(s) are not discarded.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, or the .NET events which are defined individually for each event type in the session class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.DiscardEvents(Ivi.Visa.EventType)
member.summary: Discards events of the type specified by the argument from the queue for that event type.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET. If eventType is EventType.AllEnabled the session discards all events.

remarks.para: This method causes loss of event occurrences.
The event occurrences discarded by this method are not available to a session at a later time.
This method does not affect events that have already been delivered to the application.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.EnableEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType)
member.summary: Enables a calling program's ability to receive events of the type specified by the argument using a WaitOnEvent method.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

remarks.para: Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

When an event type is enabled, events will accumulate in the event queue for that type until the calling program calls WaitOnEvent. When the session is Disposed, any undelivered events in the event queues are discarded.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.LockResource
member.summary: Acquires a lock on the resource for this session.

remarks.para: Since this overload does not specify a shared key, it will obtain an exclusive lock. Once an exclusive lock has been granted, any request for a shared lock will fail.
This overload uses an infinite timeout as the default, so that it will return only after acquiring the lock.

This overload supports nested exclusive locks. For each session, LockResource and share an internal lock count, which is initialized to 0. Each successful call to LockResource on the same session (and for the same lock type) increases the lock count. When a session locks the resource a multiple number of times, it is necessary to invoke the UnlockResource method an equal number of times in order to unlock the resource. That is, the lock count increments for each call to LockResource, and decrements for each call to UnlockResource. A resource is actually unlocked only when the lock count is 0.
If the session holds both exclusive and shared locks, successive calls to UnlockResource will first decrement the exclusive lock count to 0, and then the shared lock count.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.LockResource(System.Int32)
member.summary: Acquires a lock on the resource for this session.
member.param: If this resource is locked, the absolute time period (in milliseconds) to wait for the resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the value is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: Since this overload does not specify a shared key, it will obtain an exclusive lock. Once an exclusive lock has been granted, any request for a shared lock will fail.
This overload returns after either acquiring the lock, or after waiting for the amount of time specified by the timeout.

This overload supports nested exclusive locks. For each session, LockResource and share an internal lock count, which is initialized to 0. Each successful call to LockResource on the same session (and for the same lock type) increases the lock count. When a session locks the resource a multiple number of times, it is necessary to invoke the UnlockResource method an equal number of times in order to unlock the resource. That is, the lock count increments for each call to LockResource, and decrements for each call to UnlockResource. A resource is actually unlocked only when the lock count is 0.
If the session holds both exclusive and shared locks, successive calls to UnlockResource will first decrement the exclusive lock count to 0, and then the shared lock count.

member.summary: Acquires a lock on the resource for this session.
member.param: If this resource is locked, the absolute time period to wait for the resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: Since this overload does not specify a shared key, it will obtain an exclusive lock. Once an exclusive lock has been granted, any request for a shared lock will fail.
This overload returns after either acquiring the lock, or after waiting for the amount of time specified by the timeout.

This overload supports nested exclusive locks. For each session, LockResource and share an internal lock count, which is initialized to 0. Each successful call to LockResource on the same session (and for the same lock type) increases the lock count. When a session locks the resource a multiple number of times, it is necessary to invoke the UnlockResource method an equal number of times in order to unlock the resource. That is, the lock count increments for each call to LockResource, and decrements for each call to UnlockResource. A resource is actually unlocked only when the lock count is 0.
If the session holds both exclusive and shared locks, successive calls to UnlockResource will first decrement the exclusive lock count to 0, and then the shared lock count.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.LockResource(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Acquires a lock on the resource for this session.
member.param: If this resource is locked, the absolute time period (in milliseconds) to wait for the resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the value is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.
The name of the requested key.
member.returns: Then name of the key that was granted.

remarks.para: This overload specifies a shared key, and will obtain a shared lock. Once a shared lock has been granted, any request for a shared lock with a different shared key will fail. However, a request for an exclusive lock may succeed.
This overload of LockResource returns after either acquiring the lock, or after waiting for the amount of time specified by the timeout.

A calling program can pass null or the empty string for the sharedKey parameter, in which case this method will generate a unique access key and return it as the return value. If a user application does specify a sharedKey value, the method will try to use this value as the shared key value.

If the resource is not locked, this method will use the sharedKey as the access key and grant the lock. When the operation succeeds, the sharedKey will also be returned as the method's return value, and VISA will add the session to the list of sessions sharing the lock for the particular resource. The session obtaining a shared lock in this manner will then have the same access privileges as the first session that obtained the lock.

This overload supports nested shared locks. For each session, LockResource and share an internal lock count, which is initialized to 0. Each successful call to LockResource on the same session (and for the same lock type) increases the lock count. When a session locks the resource a multiple number of times, it is necessary to invoke the UnlockResource method an equal number of times in order to unlock the resource. That is, the lock count increments for each call to LockResource, and decrements for each call to UnlockResource. A resource is actually unlocked only when the lock count is 0.
If the session holds both exclusive and shared locks, successive calls to UnlockResource will first decrement the exclusive lock count to 0, and then the shared lock count.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.LockResource(System.TimeSpan,System.String)
member.summary: Acquires a lock on the resource for this session.

Negative time spans are not valid.
The name of the requested key.
member.returns: Then name of the key that was granted.

remarks.para: This overload specifies a shared key, and will obtain a shared lock. Once a shared lock has been granted, any request for a shared lock with a different shared key will fail. However, a request for an exclusive lock may succeed.
This overload of LockResource returns after either acquiring the lock, or after waiting for the amount of time specified by the timeout.

A calling program can pass null or the empty string for the sharedKey parameter, in which case this method will generate a unique access key and return it as the return value. If a user application does specify a sharedKey value, the method will try to use this value as the shared key value.

If the resource is not locked, this method will use the sharedKey as the access key and grant the lock. When the operation succeeds, the sharedKey will also be returned as the method's return value, and VISA will add the session to the list of sessions sharing the lock for the particular resource. The session obtaining a shared lock in this manner will then have the same access privileges as the first session that obtained the lock.

This overload supports nested shared locks. For each session, LockResource and share an internal lock count, which is initialized to 0. Each successful call to LockResource on the same session (and for the same lock type) increases the lock count. When a session locks the resource a multiple number of times, it is necessary to invoke the UnlockResource method an equal number of times in order to unlock the resource. That is, the lock count increments for each call to LockResource, and decrements for each call to UnlockResource. A resource is actually unlocked only when the lock count is 0.
If the session holds both exclusive and shared locks, successive calls to UnlockResource will first decrement the exclusive lock count to 0, and then the shared lock count.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.UnlockResource
member.summary: Unlocks the resource.

remarks.para: For each session, and UnlockResource share an internal lock count, which is initialized to 0. Each successful call to LockResource on the same session (and for the same lock type) increases the lock count. When a session locks the resource a multiple number of times, it is necessary to invoke the UnlockResource method an equal number of times in order to unlock the resource. That is, the lock count increments for each call to LockResource, and decrements for each call to UnlockResource. A resource is actually unlocked only when the lock count is 0.
It is possible to obtain both shared and exclusive locks on the same resource, in that order. In such cases, this method decrements the exclusive lock count first, and then the shared lock count.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.WaitOnEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType)
member.summary: Waits for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread on which it is called and waits for the specified event indefinitely.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

remarks.para: If eventType is EventType.AllEnabled, the function waits for any event that is enabled for the given session. In this case the calling program can determine the type of the event returned by looking at the return value EventType property.

WaitOnEvent removes the specified event from the event queue if one that matches the type is available. The process of dequeuing makes an additional space available in the queue for events of the same type.
A calling program must call to enable the reception of events of the specified type before calling WaitOnEvent. WaitOnEvent does not perform any enabling or disabling of event reception.

The return value may contain additional information specific to particular event types that is only accessible by casting to the event argument class for that type. For example, if the event is a USB Interrupt, the return value must be cast to UsbInterruptEventArgs in order to access the ExceededMaximumSize and Data properties that are specific to USB interrupt events.
Keysight VISA.NET does not implement or recognize any custom event types.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.WaitOnEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType,Ivi.Visa.EventQueueStatus@)
member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread on which it is called and waits for the specified event indefinitely.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.
The status of the event queue for the specified event type.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

remarks.para: If eventType is EventType.AllEnabled, the function waits for any event that is enabled for the given session. In this case the calling program can determine the type of the event returned by looking at the return value EventType property.

WaitOnEvent removes the specified event from the event queue if one that matches the type is available. The process of dequeuing makes an additional space available in the queue for events of the same type.
A calling program must call to enable the reception of events of the specified type before calling WaitOnEvent. WaitOnEvent does not perform any enabling or disabling of event reception.

The return value may contain additional information specific to particular event types that is only accessible by casting to the event argument class for that type. For example, if the event is a USB Interrupt, the return value must be cast to UsbInterruptEventArgs in order to access the ExceededMaximumSize and Data properties that are specific to USB interrupt events.
Keysight VISA.NET does not implement or recognize any custom event types.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.WaitOnEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread on which it is called and waits for the specified event for at least the time period specified by timeout.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

The absolute time period (in milliseconds) to wait for the event before returning. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will not wait for the event at all. If the value is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the event will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

remarks.para: If eventType is EventType.AllEnabled, the function waits for any event that is enabled for the given session. In this case the calling program can determine the type of the event returned by looking at the return value EventType property.

WaitOnEvent removes the specified event from the event queue if one that matches the type is available. The process of dequeuing makes an additional space available in the queue for events of the same type.
A calling program must call to enable the reception of events of the specified type before calling WaitOnEvent. WaitOnEvent does not perform any enabling or disabling of event reception.

The return value may contain additional information specific to particular event types that is only accessible by casting to the event argument class for that type. For example, if the event is a USB Interrupt, the return value must be cast to UsbInterruptEventArgs in order to access the ExceededMaximumSize and Data properties that are specific to USB interrupt events.
Keysight VISA.NET does not implement or recognize any custom event types.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.WaitOnEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread on which it is called and waits for the specified event for at least the time period specified by timeout.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

The absolute time period to wait for the event before returning. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will not wait for the event at all. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the event will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

remarks.para: If eventType is EventType.AllEnabled, the function waits for any event that is enabled for the given session. In this case the calling program can determine the type of the event returned by looking at the return value EventType property.

WaitOnEvent removes the specified event from the event queue if one that matches the type is available. The process of dequeuing makes an additional space available in the queue for events of the same type.
A calling program must call to enable the reception of events of the specified type before calling WaitOnEvent. WaitOnEvent does not perform any enabling or disabling of event reception.

The return value may contain additional information specific to particular event types that is only accessible by casting to the event argument class for that type. For example, if the event is a USB Interrupt, the return value must be cast to UsbInterruptEventArgs in order to access the ExceededMaximumSize and Data properties that are specific to USB interrupt events.
Keysight VISA.NET does not implement or recognize any custom event types.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.WaitOnEvent(Ivi.Visa.EventType,System.Int32,Ivi.Visa.EventQueueStatus@)
member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread on which it is called and waits for the specified event for at least the time period specified by timeout.
member.param: A VISA.NET standard event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

The absolute time period (in milliseconds) to wait for the event before returning. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will not wait for the event at all. If the value is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the event will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.
The status of the event queue for the specified event type.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

WaitOnEvent removes the specified event from the event queue if one that matches the type is available. The process of dequeuing makes an additional space available in the queue for events of the same type.

For example, if the event is a USB Interrupt, the return value must be cast to UsbInterruptEventArgs in order to access the ExceededMaximumSize and Data properties that are specific to USB interrupt events.
Keysight VISA.NET does not implement or recognize any custom event types.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#DisableEvent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disables a calling program's ability to receive events of the type specified by the argument using a WaitOnEvent method.
member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET. Values correspond to the defined values in the EventType enumeration. If eventType is "0x3fff7fff" (= EventType.AllEnabled) the session stops receiving all events.

remarks.para: This method prevents new events from being added to the event queue(s). However, event occurrences already in the queue(s) are not discarded.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods DisableEvents, DiscardEvents, EnableEvents, and WaitOnEvent with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event type in the session class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#DiscardEvents(System.Int32)
member.summary: Discards events of the type specified by the argument from the queue for that event type.
member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET. Values correspond to the defined values in the EventType enumeration. If eventType is "0x3fff7fff" (= EventType.AllEnabled) the session discards all events.

remarks.para: This method causes loss of event occurrences.
The event occurrences discarded by this method are not available to a session at a later time.
This method does not affect events that have already been delivered to the application.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods DisableEvents, DiscardEvents, EnableEvents, and WaitOnEvent with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event type in the session class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#EnableEvent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables a calling program's ability to receive events of the type specified by the argument using a WaitOnEvent method.
member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

remarks.para: Client programs should either use the event-related methods DisableEvents, DiscardEvents, EnableEvents, and WaitOnEvent with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event type in the session class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

When an event type is enabled, events will accumulate in the event queue for that type until the calling program calls WaitOnEvent. When the session is Disposed, any undelivered events in the event queues are discarded.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Keysight#Visa#IKeysightNativeVisaSession#SetAttributeByte(Keysight.Visa.KeysightAttributeByte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the value of the specified unsigned byte attribute in the native C implementation. (Keysight Specific)
member.param: A constant that identifies an unsigned byte attribute (VISA.NET standard or Keysight-specific) supported by Keysight VISA.NET.
The new value of the attribute.

remarks.para: This method will throw an exception if the specified attribute is read/write and global, and the resource is locked by another session.

In some cases VISA.NET may choose not to change the value of the attribute, and this method will still succeed. In such cases VISA would return the warning status code VI_WARN_NSUP_ATTR_STATE. Since VISA.NET does not have a mechanism for reporting warnings, this warning is not passed along to the calling program. This warning is reserved for cases where VISA.NET will continue to operate correctly despite the fact that the attribute value has not been changed.

The new value of the attribute.

This warning is reserved for cases where VISA.NET will continue to operate correctly despite the fact that the attribute value has not been changed.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#WaitOnEvent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread o which it is called and waits for the specified event indefinitely.
member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread o which it is called and waits for the specified event indefinitely.
member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.
The status of the event queue for the specified event type.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#WaitOnEvent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for an occurrence of the specified event for this session. In particular, WaitOnEvent suspends execution of the thread o which it is called and waits for the specified event for at least the time period specified by timeout.
member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

The absolute time period (in milliseconds) to wait for the event before returning. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will not wait for the event at all. If the value is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the event will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#WaitOnEvent(System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)

member.param: An integer event ID that identifies an event type supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

The absolute time period to wait for the event before returning. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will not wait for the event at all. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the event will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.
member.returns: The event arguments for the event.

The status of the event queue for the specified event type.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.InternalHandle
member.summary: The VISA C handle to the underlying VISA C session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.IsDisposed
member.summary: Indicates whether the object's Dispose code has completed (true) or not (false).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.IsDisposedSyncRoot
member.summary: The object on which Dispose creates a lock while disposing, to prevent concurrent execution of the Dispose code in multiple threads.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.EventQueueCapacity
member.summary: The maximum number of events that can be queued at any time on this session. The default is 50.

remarks.para: The range is between 1 and UInt32.MaxValue, inclusive.
This property cannot be changed after calling , beginning an asynchronous I/O operation, or registering an event handler for an event.
This property only applies to this session (VISA local scope).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.HardwareInterfaceName
member.summary: A human-readable description of the hardware interface associated with this session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.HardwareInterfaceNumber
member.summary: The board number of the hardware interface associated with this session.
member.remarks: The range is between 0 and UInt16.MaxValue, inclusive. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.HardwareInterfaceType
member.summary: The type (GPIB, ASRL, etc.) of the hardware interface associated with this session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceClass
member.summary: The resource class of the currently open resource. Possible values are INSTR, INTFC, MEMMAC, SOCKET, and BACKPLANE.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceImplementationVersion
member.summary: The version of this Keysight VISA.NET implementation.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceLockState
member.summary: The state of the resource-wide lock on the currently open resource.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceManufacturerId
member.summary: The VXI manufacturer ID of the software vendor of this VISA.NET implementation - '4095'.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceManufacturerName
member.summary: The name of the software vendor that corresponds to the ResourceManufacturerId property - 'Keysight Technologies, Inc.'.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceName
member.summary: The VISA resource name of the currently open resource. This name is the canonical version of the resource name and therefore may vary from the resourceName parameter used to instantiate the session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceSpecificationVersion
member.summary: The version of the VISA.NET specification that describes the functionality provided by this session class.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies whether callbacks must be performed in a specific synchronization context. If false, the implementation is allowed to execute callbacks in any context. The default value is true. This property applies to this session only (local scope).

remarks.para: This property applies to both I/O callbacks and events, but the point in time at which the synchronization context is captured is different. For events, context is captured at event registration, for each event type and delegate, regardless of the current state of this property. When an event is raised, the implementation uses this property to determine the context in which to invoke the delegate. For asynchronous I/O, context is captured at the begin operation (e.g. BeginRead, BeginWrite) if this property is true.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary: The I/O timeout in milliseconds for I/O communication on this resource session.

remarks.para: If the timeout is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the device to respond. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), I/O communication will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).
The default value is 2000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.Ivi#Visa#INativeVisaSession#Handle
member.summary: The session ID used by the underlying Keysight VISA C implementation that corresponds to this session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ExportEnabled
member.summary: Together with the Keysight ResourceManager.FindExportedResourcesOnly property, determines whether the resource associated with this session instance is reported by the Keysight and methods.

remarks.para: This property is specific to Keysight VISA.NET.
This property applies to the connected resource (global scope), and affects all sessions connected to the resource.

If this property is false, and if the Keysight is true, the resource associated with this session instance is not reported by the Keysight and methods. If true, or if the Keysight ResourceManager.FindExportedResourcesOnly property is false, the resource associated with this session instance is reported by the Keysight ResourceManager.Find and ResourceManager.ParseResource methods.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.ResourceManager
member.summary: A private instance of the created when this session was instantiated, and available until this session is disposed.

remarks.para: This property is specific to Keysight VISA.NET.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.WaitForLockRelease
member.summary: Indicates whether methods and properties from this session instance will wait for a timeout period for a resource lock to be released (true) or not (false).

remarks.para: This property is specific to Keysight VISA.NET.
This property only applies to this session (VISA local scope).

If WaitForLockRelease is true, and if the resource has been exclusively locked, methods and properties from this session instance will wait, for a period equal to the session timeout, for the lock to be released. If the lock is released within the timeout period, the method or property will execute normally. If the lock is not released within the timeout period, the method or property will throw an exception that indicates a timeout error rather than a locking error.

The default is false, in which case methods and properties from this session instance will not wait for the timeout period if the resource is locked. If the resource is locked, they will throw an exception that indicates a locking error.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VisaSession.SessionType
member.summary: The type of the current session.

remarks.para: This property is specific to Keysight VISA.NET.
This property only applies to this session (VISA local scope).

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a GpibInterfaceSession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and an infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a GpibInterfaceSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a GpibInterfaceSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.AssertTrigger
member.summary: Asserts a software trigger.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.PassControl(System.Int16)
member.summary: Tells the GPIB device at the specified address to become controller in charge (CIC).
member.param: The primary address of the GPIB device.

remarks.para: This operation passes controller in charge status to the device indicated by primaryAddress and then deasserts the ATN line.
This method assumes that the targeted device has controller capability.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.PassControl(System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Tells the GPIB device at the specified address to become controller in charge (CIC).
member.param: The primary address of the GPIB device.
The secondary address of the GPIB device.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.ControlAtn(Ivi.Visa.AtnMode)
member.summary: Controls the state of the GPIB ATN interface line, and optionally the active controller state of the local interface board.
member.param: The action to be taken with respect to the GPIB ATN line.

remarks.para: This operation asserts or deasserts the GPIB ATN interface line according to the specified mode. The mode can also specify whether the local interface board should acquire or release Controller Active status.
It is generally not necessary to use the viGpibControlATN operation in most applications. Other methods such as PassControl and modify the ATN and/or CIC state automatically.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.SendCommand(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes GPIB command bytes on the bus.
member.param: The GPIB command bytes.
member.returns: The number of bytes actually written.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.SendRemoteLocalCommand(Ivi.Visa.GpibInterfaceRemoteLocalMode)
member.summary: Controls the state of the GPIB REN interface line and, optionally, the remote/local state of the device.
member.param: The action to be taken with respect to the GPIB REN line.

remarks.para: This operation asserts or deasserts the GPIB REN interface line according to the specified mode. The mode can also specify whether the device associated with this session should be placed in local state (before deasserting REN) or remote state (after asserting REN).
This operation is valid only if the GPIB interface associated with this session is currently the system controller.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.SendInterfaceClear
member.summary: Pulses the interface clear line (IFC) for at least 100 microseconds. This operation asserts the IFC line and the local interface becomes controller in charge (CIC).

remarks.para: The local board must be the system controller.

member.summary: Requests the session to terminate normal execution of an asynchronous read or write operation.
member.param: Information about the progress and results of the asynchronous operation that is specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#BeginRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read bytes asynchronously and store them in the Async Results Buffer/>.
member.param: The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: Information about the progress and results of the asynchronous operation that is specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

remarks.para: The calling program can detect when the I/O is complete using polling or using the wait handle in the asynchronous results returned by the method. For more details refer to the asynchronous I/O examples in the "Using VISA.NET" section of the VISA.NET help file.

The EndRead method must be called whenever BeginRead completes successfully and returns a non-null IVisaAsyncResult. If it is not called, the implementation may leak memory associated with the underlying asynchronous operation.

Keysight IO Libraries Suite allows only a single thread at a time from a given session to access the device. To perform multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously, you can work around this limitation by opening multiple sessions to the device and doing one asynchronous call on each session. However, it is the responsibility of the calling program to insure that multiple asynchronous operations to a device are properly coordinated.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#Read
member.summary: Read bytes until a newline or END is reached, whichever comes first.
member.returns: An array of the bytes read.

remarks.para: If the device does not use a newline as it's termination character, you may have to change the TerminationCharacter to match what the device uses.

Not all devices and I/O interfaces correctly handle or generate END indicators. In general VISA.NET can accomodate these discrepancies, but you may need to tweak properties like SendEndEnabled in order to read from the device.

member.returns: An array of the bytes read.

member.summary: Read bytes into the buffer, starting at , or until a newline or END is reached, whichever comes first.
member.param: An array of bytes allocated by the calling program.
The index in to begin storing bytes
The number of bytes to read.
The actual count of bytes stored in during the read operation.
A status that indicates whether an END or newline terminated the read operation.

remarks.para: If the device does not use a newline as it's termination character, you may have to change the TerminationCharacter to match what the device uses.

Not all devices and I/O interfaces correctly handle or generate END indicators. In general VISA.NET can accomodate these discrepancies, but you may need to tweak properties like SendEndEnabled in order to read from the device.

This overload of the read method is unsafe because it uses a .NET pointer internally. The tradeoff is that it eliminates an uneeded copy from the unmanaged buffer to the .NET buffer parameter, which should result in noticeably better performance for large buffers.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.Cleared
member.summary: Occurs when the GPIB controller has been sent a device clear message.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.AddressState
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified GPIB interface is currently addressed to talk or listen, or is not addressed.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.AllowDma
member.summary: Indicates whether I/O accesses should use DMA (true) or Programmed I/O (false). For some GPIB cards, this attribute may have global effects even though it is documented to be a local attribute, which may affect performance but not functionality.

remarks.para: The default is true.
For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change whether DMA is enabled, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.AtnState
member.summary: The current state of the GPIB ATN (ATtentioN) interface line.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.HS488CableLength
member.summary: The total length of the GPIB cable used in this GPIB interface, in meters.

remarks.para: The range is between 1 and 15 inclusive. The property may also return 0 (HS488 disabled) or -1 (HS488 not implemented).
If HS488 is not supported by this GPIB interface, attempts to set this property will throw an exception.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.DeviceStatusByte
member.summary: The 488-style status byte of the local controller associated with this session. Trying to set this property to a value other than 0 will normally result in an exception.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and Byte.MaxValue, inclusive.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.IOProtocol
member.summary: The protocol type for I/O communication with the physical resource.

remarks.para: For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change the protocol type, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.
For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change the protocol type, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.
For GPIB sessions you can choose between IOProtocol.Normal and IOProtocol.HS488 (high-speed) data transfers.
The default is IOProtocol.Normal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.IsControllerInCharge
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified GPIB interface is currently the controller in charge (CIC).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.IsSystemController
member.summary: Specifies whether the specified GPIB interface is currently the system controller.

remarks.para: For some configurations this attribute may be modified only through a configuration utility. For these cases, trying to set this property will throw an exception.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.NdacState
member.summary: The current state of the GPIB NDAC (Not Data ACcepted) interface line.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.PrimaryAddress
member.summary: The primary address of the local GPIB controller used by the given session.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 30, inclusive.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.RenState
member.summary: The current state of the GPIB REN (Remote ENable) interface line.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.SecondaryAddress
member.summary: The secondary address of the local GPIB controller used by the given session.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 30, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that there is no secondary address. The default is -1.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.SendEndEnabled
member.summary: Enables/disables asserting an END on the last byte of a write.

remarks.para: The default is true.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.SrqState
member.summary: The current state of the GPIB SRQ (Service ReQuest) interface line.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.TerminationCharacter
member.summary: The ASCII character used to terminate a raw I/O read operation.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and Byte.MaxValue, inclusive. The default is 0x0a (line feed).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.TerminationCharacterEnabled
member.summary: If true, a raw I/O read operation ends when a termination character is received.

remarks.para: The default is false.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.RawIO
member.summary: A reference to the raw I/O interface.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibInterfaceSession.RemoteInterfaceProtocol
member.summary: The LAN protocol used for remote sessions. (Keysight Specific)

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap
member.summary: The MemoryMap class is an support class that supports MEMACC operations for the PxiMemorySession and VxiMemorySession classes. It derives from .

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.Dispose
member.summary: Performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this session.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this implementation of Keysight VISA.NET, but only if another thread has not already started to dispose of this object.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Throws an exception if the object is already disposed.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.Peek8(System.Int64)
member.summary: Read a byte from in the mapped memory.
member.param: Specifies the source offset of the value to be read.
member.returns: The byte that was read.

remarks.para: The mapped memory is mapped in the MemoryMap class constructor.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.IsDisposed
member.summary: True if the object Dispose code has completed.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.IsDisposedSyncRoot
member.summary: Dispose creates a lock on this object while disposing, to prevent concurrent execution of the Dispose code in multiple threads.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.AddressSpace
member.summary: The address space that is currently mapped to this session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.BaseAddress
member.summary: The starting address of the memory that is currently mapped to this session.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.Size
member.summary: The size of the memory that is currently mapped to this session, starting at the

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MemoryMap.VirtualAddress
member.summary: Returns IntPtr.Zero if the window is only accessible through the operations provided on this interface. A return value other than IntPtr.Zero indicates you can dereference the mapped address as a pointer.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedRawIO.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#AbortAsyncOperation(Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult)
member.summary: Requests the session to terminate normal execution of an asynchronous read or write operation.
member.param: Information about the progress and results of the asynchronous operation that is specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedRawIO.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#BeginRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read bytes asynchronously and store them in the asynchronous results Buffer/>.
member.param: The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: Information about the progress and results of the asynchronous operation that is specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

remarks.para: The calling program can detect when the I/O is complete using polling or using the wait handle in the asynchronous results returned by the method. For more details refer to the asynchronous I/O examples in the "Using VISA.NET" section of the VISA.NET help file.

The EndRead method must be called whenever BeginRead completes successfully and returns a non-null IVisaAsyncResult. If it is not called, the implementation may leak memory associated with the underlying asynchronous operation.

Keysight IO Libraries Suite allows only a single thread at a time from a given session to access the device. To perform multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously, you can work around this limitation by opening multiple sessions to the device and doing one asynchronous call on each session. However, it is the responsibility of the calling program to insure that multiple asynchronous operations to a device are properly coordinated.

member.summary: Read bytes asynchronously and store them in the Async Results Buffer/>.

To perform multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously, you can work around this limitation by opening multiple sessions to the device and doing one asynchronous call on each session. However, it is the responsibility of the calling program to insure that multiple asynchronous operations to a device are properly coordinated.

member.param: The bytes to be written to the device.

The method to call when the operation is complete.
Information about the state of this particular asynchronous operation that is attached to the Async Results.

remarks.para: The calling program can detect when the I/O is complete using polling, using the wait handle in the asynchronous results returned by the method, or waiting for the callback method to be called. For more details refer to the asynchronous I/O examples in the "Using VISA.NET" section of the VISA.NET help file.

To perform multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously, you can work around this limitation by opening multiple sessions to the device and doing one asynchronous call on each session. However, it is the responsibility of the calling program to insure that multiple asynchronous operations to a device are properly coordinated.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedRawIO.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#Read
member.summary: Read bytes until a newline or END is reached, whichever comes first.
member.returns: An array of the bytes read.

remarks.para: If the device does not use a newline as it's termination character, you may have to change the TerminationCharacter to match what the device uses.

Not all devices and I/O interfaces correctly handle or generate END indicators. In general VISA.NET can accomodate these discrepancies, but you may need to tweak properties like SendEndEnabled in order to read from the device.

This overload of the read method is unsafe because it uses a .NET pointer internally. The tradeoff is that it eliminates an uneeded copy from the unmanaged buffer to the .NET buffer parameter, which should result in noticeably better performance for large buffers.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all PXI BACKPLANE sessions.

remarks.para: PXI instrument vendors do not ordinarily expose the information needed to directly access a PXI instrument. This information is cryptic and may change from one firmware version to the next. Instead, vendors provide instrument drivers, software front panels, and other programs for instrument access. Under normal circumstances, instrument users should not attempt to access PXI backplanes or instruments using this class.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a PxiBackplaneSession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and an infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a PxiBackplaneSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception; otherwise, this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never time out. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually added, Open does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a PxiBackplaneSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception; otherwise, this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never time out. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.
Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually added, Open does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.ReserveTrigger(System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Reserve a single trigger line that the caller can then map and/or assert.
member.param: The bus segment in which to reserve the trigger.
The trigger line to reserve.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.ReserveTriggers(System.Int16[],Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine[])
member.summary: Reserve multiple trigger lines that the caller can then map and/or assert.
member.param: The bus segments in which to reserve the triggers.
The trigger lines to reserve.

remarks.para: This method will succeed only if it can reserve all of the bus/line pairs. If any of the bus/line pairs cannot be reserved, this method will not reserve any of them.
Note that the buses and lines arrays are parallel: the lengths must be the same, and buses[n] corresponds to lines[n].

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.UnreserveTrigger(System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Unreserve a single trigger line that the caller previously reserved.
member.param: The bus segment in which to unreserve the trigger.
The trigger line to unreserve.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.MapTrigger(System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Maps the specified source trigger line to the specified destination trigger line.
member.param: The bus segment of the source trigger line.
The source trigger line.
The bus segment of the destination trigger line.
The destination trigger line.

remarks.para: Mapping a trigger line (as either source or destination) multiple times requires special hardware capabilities and is not guaranteed to be implemented.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with the same source trigger line and different destination trigger lines, the result should be that when the source trigger line is asserted all specified destination trigger lines should also be asserted.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with different source trigger lines and the same destination trigger line the result should be that when any of the specified source trigger lines is asserted, the destination trigger line should also be asserted.
Mapping one trigger line to another modifies the state of hardware. Therefore, the effect continues beyond the scope of the VISA.NET session that mapped it, even if that VISA.NET session is closed.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.MapTrigger(System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Maps the specified source trigger line to the specified destination trigger line.
member.param: The bus segment of the source trigger line.
The source trigger line.
The bus segment of the destination trigger line.
The destination trigger line.
If true, the trigger has already been mapped.

remarks.para: Mapping a trigger line (as either source or destination) multiple times requires special hardware capabilities and is not guaranteed to be implemented.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with the same source trigger line and different destination trigger lines, the result should be that when the source trigger line is asserted all specified destination trigger lines should also be asserted.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with different source trigger lines and the same destination trigger line the result should be that when any of the specified source trigger lines is asserted, the destination trigger line should also be asserted.
Mapping one trigger line to another modifies the state of hardware. Therefore, the effect continues beyond the scope of the VISA.NET session that mapped it, even if that VISA.NET session is closed.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.UnmapTrigger(System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Unmaps the specified source trigger line.
member.param: The bus segment of the source trigger line.
The source trigger line.

remarks.para: This operation unmaps only one trigger mapping per call. If MapTrigger was called multiple times on the same backplane resource and created multiple mappings for the trigger source, trigger mappings other than the one specified by the trigger source remain in effect after this call completes.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.UnmapTrigger(System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,System.Int16,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Unmaps the specified source trigger line from the specified destination trigger line.
member.param: The bus segment of the source trigger line.
The source trigger line.
The bus segment of the destination trigger line.
The destination trigger line.

remarks.para: This operation unmaps only one trigger mapping per call. If MapTrigger was called multiple times on the same backplane resource and created multiple mappings for either the trigger source or destination, trigger mappings other than the one specified by the trigger source or destination remain in effect after this call completes.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.ChassisNumber
member.summary: The identification number of this PXI chassis.

remarks.para: The range is from 1 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the chassis is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.ManufacturerName

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiBackplaneSession.ModelName

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.MapAddress(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Maps the specified memory space into this processs address space.
member.param: Specifies the address space to map.
Offset (in bytes) of the memory to be mapped.
Amount of memory to map (in bytes).
member.returns: An IMemoryMapIMemoryMap interface reference to an instance of the class, which provides the ability to Peek and Poke mapped memory.

remarks.para: You can only have one map at a time for a given session. If you need to have multiple maps to a device, you must open one session for each map needed.
For instrument (INSTR) sessions, the parameter is rthe offset address elative to the device's allocated address base for the corresponding address space specified.
For VXI memory access (MEMACC) sessions, the parameter is an absolute offset from the start of the VXI mapSpace.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.In8(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64)
member.summary: Read in an 8-bit value from the specified memory space (assigned memory base + offset).
member.param: The address space.
The offset in bytes of the address or register from which to read.
member.returns: The data read from the bus.

remarks.para: MapAddress does not need to be called before calling this method.
If this session is a memory access (MEMACC) session, the parameter specifies an absolute address.

The "high-level" In and Out methods operate independently of the "low-level" Peek and Poke methods defined in the class, regardless of the configured state of the hardware that is used to perform memory accesses.
