The offset (in bytes) of the starting address or register to which to write.
The data to write to the bus.

remarks.para: You do not need to call MapAddress before calling this method.
If this session is a memory access (MEMACC) session, the parameter specifies an absolute address.

The high-level In and Out methods operate independently of the low-level Peek and Poke methods defined in the class, regardless of the configured state of the hardware that is used to perform memory accesses.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.MoveIn8(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Moves an 8-bit block of data from the specified memory space (assigned memory base + offset) to local memory.
member.param: The address space.
The offset (in bytes) of the address or register from which bytes are moved.
The number of elements to transfer.
member.returns: The data read from the bus.

remarks.para: If the session is an instrument (INSTR) session, the parameter specifies a relative offset from the start of the instruments address space. If the session is a memory access (MEMACC) session, the parameter is an absolute offset from the start of memory in the specified address space.
All operations on a PXI memory access session that accept a space parameter to indicate the address space for bus access will accept the value .

The parameter is the number of 8-bit elements to transfer, beginning at the specified offset. Therefore, (sourceOffset + count) cannot exceed the amount of memory exported by the device in the given space.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.AllowDma
member.summary: Specifies whether direct memory access is enabled.

remarks.para: For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change whether DMA is enabled, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.DestinationIncrement
member.summary: For MoveOut methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.

remarks.para: For MoveOutXX methods, this property specifies how much the destination offset will be incremented after every transfer.
The default value of this attribute is 1, indicating that the destination address will be incremented by 1 after each transfer, so that items are moved into consecutive elements.
If this property is set to 0, the MoveOutXX methods will always write to the same element, essentially treating the destination as a FIFO register.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.RegisterBasedSession.SourceIncrement
member.summary: For MoveIn methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.

remarks.para: For MoveInXX methods, this property specifies how much the source offset will be incremented after every transfer.
The default value of this attribute is 1, indicating that the source address will be incremented by 1 after each transfer, so that items are moved from consecutive elements.
If this property is set to 0, the MoveInXX methods will always read from the same element, essentially treating the source as a FIFO register.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiMemorySession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a PxiMemorySession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and an infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiMemorySession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a PxiMemorySession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiMemorySession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a PxiMemorySession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiMemorySession.MemoryAllocate(System.Int64)
member.summary: Allocates memory from the devices memory region.
member.param: The size of the allocated memory in bytes.
member.returns: The offset of the allocated device memory.

remarks.para: The offset returned for a PXI memory session is an absolute physical address of a contiguous block of memory that has been allocated by the operating system. The memory block is locked, meaning it will not be swapped out. A common use for this memory is to do user-mode DMA to or from a PXI device.

Both the high-level memory access functions defined in RegisterBasedSession (InXX, OutXX, MoveInXX, MoveOutXX) and the low-level memory access functions defined in the MemoryMap class (PeekXX, PokeXX) can be used to access the allocated memory.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiMemorySession.MemoryAllocate(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocate memory from the devices memory region.
member.param: The size of the allocated memory in bytes.
The entire allocated region must be in the 32-bit address range.
member.returns: The offset of the allocated device memory.

remarks.para: The absolute physical address of a contiguous block of memory which has been allocated by the operating system. The memory block is also locked, meaning it will not be swapped out. A common use for this memory is to do user-mode DMA to or from a PXI device.

Both the high-level memory access functions defined in RegisterBasedSession (InXX, OutXX, MoveInXX, MoveOutXX) and the low-level memory access functions defined in the MemoryMap class (PeekXX, PokeXX) can be used to access the allocated memory.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.PxiMemorySession.MemoryFree(System.Int64)
member.summary: Frees previously-allocated memory.
member.param: The offset of the allocated device memory.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all PXI INSTR sessions.

remarks.para: PXI instrument vendors do not ordinarily expose the information needed to directly access a PXI instrument. This information is cryptic and may change from one firmware version to the next. Instead, vendors provide instrument drivers, software front panels, and other programs for instrument access. Under normal circumstances, instrument users should not attempt to access PXI instruments using this class.

member.summary: Keysight VISA.NET does not support this method.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.Interrupt
member.summary: Occurs when a PXI interrupt is received from the device.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.ActualLinkWidth
member.summary: The actual, negotiated link width.

remarks.para: The value may be 1, 4 or 8.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.AllowWriteCombining
member.summary:
Specifies whether the implementation should attempt to combine bus write transfers into a larger transfer before bursting over the PCI bus.
The default is false.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.BusNumber
member.summary: The PCI bus number.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 255, inclusive.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.ChassisNumber
member.summary: The identification number of the chassis where this device is located. If the chassis has not been identified, this property returns -1.

remarks.para: The range is from 1 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the chassis is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.DeviceNumber
member.summary: The PCI device number.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 31, inclusive.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.DstarBusNumber
member.summary: The differential star bus number.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the bus is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.DstarLineSet
member.summary: The connected set of PXI Express differential star bus lines.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the bus is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.FunctionNumber
member.summary: The PCI function number.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 7, inclusive.
All devices have a function 0. Multifunction devices will also support other function numbers.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.IsExpress
member.summary: If true, the device is a PXI Express device.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.ManufacturerId
member.summary: The subsystem PCI vendor identification number of the hardware vendor for this device, or if the subsystem information does not exist, the primary PCI vendor identification number.

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.ManufacturerName
member.summary: The name of the hardware vendor that corresponds to the ManufacturerId property.

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.ModelCode
member.summary: The vendor-specific subsystem PCI model number for this device, or if the subsystem information does not exist, the primary PCI model number.

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.ModelName
member.summary: The name of this device (corresponds to the ModelCode property).

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.Slot
member.summary: The physical slot location of this device within its chassis. If the location is not known, this property returns VisaConstants.UnknownSlotNumber.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.SlotLinkWidth
member.summary: The link width used by the slot.

remarks.para: The value may be 1, 4 or 8.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.SlotLocalBusLeft
member.summary: The slot number or special feature connected to local left bus lines.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the slot is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.SlotLocalBusRight
member.summary: The slot number or special feature connected to local right bus lines.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the slot is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.SlotPath
member.summary: The slot path.

remarks.para: PXI slot paths are a sequence of values representing the PCI device number and function number of a PCI module and each parent PCI bridge that routes the module to the host PCI bridge. The string format of the attribute value is device1[.function1][,device2[.function2]][,...].

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.StarTriggerBus
member.summary: The value for the PXI star trigger bus.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the trigger is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.StarTriggerLine
member.summary: The value for the connected PXI star trigger line.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the trigger is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.PxiSession.TriggerBus
member.summary: The trigger bus number of this device.

remarks.para: The range is from 0 to 32767, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the trigger is unknown.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all GPIB INSTR sessions.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession
member.summary: An abstract (non-instantiable by itself) class inherited by all VISA.NET message-based session classes.

remarks.para: Although it is technically possible, Keysight recommends that customers not derive custom classes from this class. Attempts to override some methods may result in a stack overflow when the method is called.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.#ctor(Keysight.Visa.SessionType,System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate the MessageBasedSession portion of a class that derives from it.
member.param: The type of the derived session that is calling this constructor.
The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to IO Libraries Connection Expert documentation for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered in Keysight Connection Expert, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, Open does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.#ctor(Keysight.Visa.SessionType,System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate the MessageBasedSession portion of a class that derives from it.
member.param: The type of the derived session that is calling this constructor.
The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to IO Libraries Connection Expert documentation for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered in Keysight Connection Expert, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, Open does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.AssertTrigger
member.summary: Asserts a software or hardware trigger, depending on the default trigger protocol for the session type.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.Clear
member.summary: Performs an IEEE 488.1-style clear of the device and clears the input and output buffer (both raw and formatted I/O buffers). It also may terminate ending operations on the device.

remarks.para: For a GPIB session, this method sends a Device Clear to the device.
For a TCPIP socket session, if IOProtocol property is Ieee4882, this method sends the the string "*CLS\n" to the device. Otherwise, this operation is not valid.
For a serial session, this method flushes the instrument buffer.
For a USB session, this method sends the INITIATE_CLEAR and CHECK_CLEAR_STATUS commands on the control pipe.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.ReadStatusByte
member.summary: Reads the status from the device. For 488.2 instruments, this is the 488.2 status byte.
member.returns: A value that indicates which status byte bits are set.

remarks.para: For a session to a Serial device or TCPIP socket, if IOProtocol is Ieee4882, this method sends the string "*STB?\n" to the device, and reads the status byte. If IOProtocol is not Ieee4882, this method cannot return the status byte. If the status information is only one byte long, the most significant byte is returned with the zero value. If the service requester does not respond in the actual timeout period, the method times out.
For a session to a USB instrument, this function sends the READ_STATUS_BYTE command on the control pipe.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#AbortAsyncOperation(Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult)
member.summary: Requests the session to terminate normal execution of an asynchronous read or write operation.
member.param: Information about the progress and results of the asynchronous operation that is specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#BeginRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read bytes asynchronously and store them in the asynchronous results Buffer/>.
member.param: The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: Information about the progress and results of the asynchronous operation that is specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

remarks.para: The calling program can detect when the I/O is complete using polling or using the wait handle in the asynchronous results returned by the method. For more details refer to the asynchronous I/O examples in the "Using VISA.NET" section of the VISA.NET help file.

The EndRead method must be called whenever BeginRead completes successfully and returns a non-null IVisaAsyncResult. If it is not called, the implementation may leak memory associated with the underlying asynchronous operation.

Keysight IO Libraries Suite allows only a single thread at a time from a given session to access the device. To perform multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously, you can work around this limitation by opening multiple sessions to the device and doing one asynchronous call on each session. However, it is the responsibility of the calling program to insure that multiple asynchronous operations to a device are properly coordinated.

The EndWrite method must be called whenever BeginWrite completes successfully and returns a non-null IVisaAsyncResult. If it is not called, the implementation may leak memory associated with the underlying asynchronous operation.

Keysight IO Libraries Suite allows only a single thread at a time from a given session to access the device. To perform multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously, you can work around this limitation by opening multiple sessions to the device and doing one asynchronous call on each session. However, it is the responsibility of the calling program to insure that multiple asynchronous operations to a device are properly coordinated.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#Read
member.summary: Read bytes until a newline or END is reached, whichever comes first.
member.returns: An array of the bytes read.

remarks.para: If the device does not use a newline as it's termination character, you may have to change the TerminationCharacter to match what the device uses.

Not all devices and I/O interfaces correctly handle or generate END indicators. In general VISA.NET can accomodate these discrepancies, but you may need to tweak properties like SendEndEnabled in order to read from the device.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.Ivi#Visa#IMessageBasedRawIO#Read(System.Byte[],System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@,Ivi.Visa.ReadStatus@)
member.summary: Read bytes into the buffer, starting at , or until a newline or END is reached, whichever comes first.
member.param: An array of bytes allocated by the calling program.
The index in to begin storing bytes
The number of bytes to read.
The actual count of bytes stored in during the read operation.
A status that indicates whether an END or newline terminated the read operation.

remarks.para: If the device does not use a newline as it's termination character, you may have to change the TerminationCharacter to match what the device uses.

Not all devices and I/O interfaces correctly handle or generate END indicators. In general VISA.NET can accomodate these discrepancies, but you may need to tweak properties like SendEndEnabled in order to read from the device.

This overload of the read method is unsafe because it uses a .NET pointer internally. The tradeoff is that it eliminates an uneeded copy from the unmanaged buffer to the .NET buffer parameter, which should result in noticeably better performance for large buffers.

Not all devices and I/O interfaces correctly handle or generate END indicators. In general VISA.NET can accomodate these discrepancies, but you may need to tweak properties like SendEndEnabled in order to read from the device.

This overload of the read method is unsafe because it uses a .NET pointer for the read buffer parameter. The tradeoff is that it eliminates an uneeded copy from the unmanaged buffer to the .NET buffer parameter, which should result in noticeably better performance for large buffers.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.ServiceRequest
member.summary: Occurs when a service request is received from the device.

remarks.para: When this event is received, client code should call .
Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.IOProtocol
member.summary: The protocol type for I/O communication with the device. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).

remarks.para: For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change the protocol type to certain values, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.
For VXI sessions you can choose between IOProtocol.Normal (normal word serial) or IOProtocol.Fdc (fast data channel, or FDC). The default for VXI is IOProtocol.Normal.
For GPIB sessions you can choose between IOProtocol.Normal and IOProtocol.HS488 (high-speed) data transfers. The default for GPIB is IOProtocol.Ieee4882.

For ASRL sessions, you can choose between IOProtocol.Normal and IOProtocol.Ieee4882 (IEEE 488.2 style transfers), in which case the Serial AssertTrigger, ReadSTB, and Clear methods send 488.2-defined strings. The default for Serial is IOProtocol.Ieee4882.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.SendEndEnabled
member.summary: Enables/disables sending the END signal on the last byte of a write. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).

remarks.para: The default is true.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.TerminationCharacter
member.summary: The ASCII character used to end reading. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and Byte.MaxValue, inclusive. The default is 0x0a (line feed).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.TerminationCharacterEnabled
member.summary: If true, read operations end when a termination character is received. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).

remarks.para: The default is false.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.FormattedIO
member.summary: A reference to the Formatted I/O interface. Keysight VISA.NET uses the standard Formatted I/O implementation provided by the IVI Foundation in the VISA.NET Shared Components.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.MessageBasedSession.RawIO
member.summary: A reference to the raw (no formatting) I/O interface.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a GpibSession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and and infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a GpibSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform the operations necessary to instantiate a GpibSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.SendRemoteLocalCommand(Ivi.Visa.GpibInstrumentRemoteLocalMode)
member.summary: Controls the state of the GPIB REN interface line and, optionally, the remote/local state of the device.
member.param: Indicates the action to be taken.

remarks.para: This operation asserts or deasserts the GPIB REN interface line according to the specified mode. The mode can also specify whether the device associated with this session should be placed in local state (before deasserting REN) or remote state (after asserting REN).
RemoteLocalMode.LocalWithoutLockout maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.GoToLocalDeassertRen.
RemoteLocalMode.Remote maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.AddressDeviceAssertRen.
RemoteLocalMode.RemoteWithLocalLockout maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.AddressDeviceSendLocalLockout.
RemoteLocalMode.Local maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.GoToLocal.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.SendRemoteLocalCommand(Ivi.Visa.RemoteLocalMode)
member.summary: Controls the state of the GPIB REN interface line and, optionally, the remote/local state of the device.
member.param: Indicates the action to be taken.

remarks.para: This operation asserts or deasserts the GPIB REN interface line according to the specified mode. The mode can also specify whether the device associated with this session should be placed in local state (before deasserting REN) or remote state (after asserting REN).
RemoteLocalMode.LocalWithoutLockout maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.GoToLocalDeassertRen.
RemoteLocalMode.Remote maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.AddressDeviceAssertRen.
RemoteLocalMode.RemoteWithLocalLockout maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.AddressDeviceSendLocalLockout.
RemoteLocalMode.Local maps to GpibInstrRemoteLocalMode.GoToLocal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.AllowDma
member.summary: Specifies whether direct memory access is enabled. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).

remarks.para: The default is true.
For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change whether DMA is enabled, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.PrimaryAddress
member.summary: The primary address of the GPIB device used by the given session.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 30, inclusive.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.ReaddressingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to use repeat addressing before each read or write operation. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope).

remarks.para: The default value is true.
For some configurations, this property may not allow you to change whether DMA is enabled, so reading this property's value back may not echo the value that was set.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.RenState
member.summary: The current state of the GPIB REN interface line.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.SecondaryAddress
member.summary: The secondary address of the GPIB device used by the given session.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 30, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that there is no secondary address. The default is -1.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.GpibSession.UnaddressingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to unaddress the device (UNT and UNL) after each read or write operation. This property applies to this session only (VISA local scope). Trying to set this property to a value other than false will normally result in an exception.

remarks.para: The default value is false.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.SetBufferSize(Ivi.Visa.IOBuffers,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the size of the read and/or write buffer for serial communication.
member.param: The buffer(s) to be resized.
The new size of the buffer(s).
member.returns: Indicates whether the buffer size was successfully reset.

remarks.para: Not all serial drivers support user-defined buffer sizes, so it is possible that a this method may not be able to control this feature. If an application requires a specific buffer size for performance reasons, but this method cannot control the size, Keysight recommends that the calling program use some form of handshaking to prevent overflow conditions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.BytesAvailable
member.summary: The number of bytes available in the global receive buffer.

remarks.para: The range is between Int32.MinValue and Int32.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int32.MaxValue + 1 and UInt32.MaxValue before they are used. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.BaudRate
member.summary: The baud rate of the interface.

remarks.para: The range is between Int32.MinValue and Int32.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int32.MaxValue + 1 and UInt32.MaxValue before they are used. The default is 9600.
When setting this property, the calling program must specify a value that is supported by the hardware being used.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.ClearToSendState
member.summary: The current state of the Clear To Send (CTS) input signal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.DataBits
member.summary: The number of data bits contained in each frame (5, 6, 7, or 8).

remarks.para: The range is between 5 and 8, inclusive. The default is 8.
The data bits for each frame are located in the low-order bits of every byte stored in memory.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.DataCarrierDetectState
member.summary: The current state of the Data Carrier Detect (DCD) input signal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.DataSetReadyState
member.summary: The current state of the Data Set Ready (DSR) input signal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.DataTerminalReadyState
member.summary: The state of the Data Terminal Ready (DTR) output signal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.FlowControl
member.summary: The flow control mechanism(s) used by this serial connection.

remarks.para: The default is .
If set to SerialFlowControlModes.None, the transfer mechanism does not use flow control, and buffers on both sides of the connection are assumed to be large enough to hold all data transferred.

If set to , the transfer mechanism uses the XON and XOFF characters to perform flow control. The transfer mechanism controls input flow by sending XOFF when the receive buffer is nearly full, and it controls the output flow by suspending transmission when XOFF is received.

If set to , the transfer mechanism uses the RTS output signal and the CTS input signal to perform flow control. The transfer mechanism controls input flow by unasserting the RTS signal when the receive buffer is nearly full, and it controls output flow by suspending the transmission when the CTS signal is unasserted.

If set to , the transfer mechanism uses the DTR output signal and the DSR input signal to perform flow control. The transfer mechanism controls input flow by unasserting the DTR signal when the receive buffer is nearly full, and it controls output flow by suspending the transmission when the DSR signal is unasserted.

This attribute can specify multiple flow control mechanisms by bit-ORing multiple values together. However, certain combinations may not be supported by all serial ports and/or operating systems. Note that Keysight Connection Expert cannot be used to specify multiple flow control mechanisms; it must be done programmatically.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.Parity
member.summary: The parity used with every frame transmitted and received.

remarks.para: The default is .

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.ReadTermination
member.summary: The method used to terminate read operations.

remarks.para: The default is .

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.ReplacementCharacter
member.summary: The character used to replace incoming characters that arrive with errors (such as parity errors).

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and Byte.MaxValue, inclusive. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.RequestToSendState
member.summary: The current state of the Request To Send (RTS) output signal.

remarks.para: If is equal to , this property is ignored when changed, but can be read to determine whether the background flow control is asserting or unasserting the signal.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.RingIndicatorState
member.summary: The current state of the Ring Indicator (RI) input signal.

remarks.para: The RI signal is often used by modems to indicate that the telephone line is ringing.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.StopBits
member.summary: The number of stop bits used to indicate the end of a frame.

remarks.para: The default is .

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.WriteTermination
member.summary: The method used to terminate write operations.

remarks.para: The default is .

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.XOffCharacter
member.summary: The value of the XOFF character used for XON/XOFF flow control (both directions).

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and Byte.MaxValue, inclusive. The default is 0x13 (ctrl+S).
If is not equal to , this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.SerialSession.XOnCharacter
member.summary: The value of the XON character used for XON/XOFF flow control (both directions).

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and Byte.MaxValue, inclusive. The default is 0x11 (ctrl+Q).
If is not equal to , this property is ignored.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all TCPIP INSTR sessions.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a TcpipSession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and and infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a TcpipSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a TcpipSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.summary: The LAN device name used by the VXI-11 or HiSLIP protocol during connection.

member.summary: The host name of the device. If no host name is available, this property is set to the empty string.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.Port
member.summary: The device-side port number being used for communication.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.IsHiSLIP
member.summary: If true, this session is a HiSLIP session.

remarks.para: If the session is not a HiSLIP session, the HiSLIP specific properties will throw an exception (, , and ).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.HiSLIPOverlapEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the HiSLIP "overlap" mode is enabled.

remarks.para: The default is the mode suggested by the connected device.

If enabled, the connection uses overlap mode to allow overlapped responses. If disabled, the connection uses synchronous mode to detect and recover from interrupted errors. If changed, VISA.NET will do a Device Clear operation to change the mode.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.HiSLIPProtocolVersion
member.summary: The negotiated HiSLIP protocol version.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.HiSLIPMaximumMessageKBytes
member.summary: The HiSLIP maximum message size in kilobytes, where a kilobyte is 1024 bytes.

remarks.para: The range is between Int32.MinValue and Int32.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int32.MaxValue + 1 and UInt32.MaxValue before they are used. The default is 1024, which results in a 1 MB maximum message size.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSession.RemoteHardwareInterfaceType
member.summary: The type (GPIB, ASRL, etc.) of the remote hardware interface associated with this session.

remarks.para: This property is specific to Keysight VISA.NET.
Remote VXI session only support message-based VXI devices. VXI memory access methods (for example, the Peek and Poke methods) are not supported over LAN.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSocketSession.KeepAlive
member.summary: If true, the TCP/IP provider enables the use of keep-alive packets on TCP connections.

remarks.para: If a connection is dropped as a result of "keep-alives," any current or subsequent I/O calls on the session will throw an exception.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSocketSession.NoDelay
member.summary: If true, the Nagle algorithm is disabled.

remarks.para: The Nagle algorithm improves network performance by buffering "send" data until a full-size packet can be sent. This attribute is enabled by default in VISA.NET to verify that synchronous writes get flushed immediately.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.TcpipSocketSession.Port
member.summary: The port number for a given TCP/IP address (required for a TCP/IP SOCKET resource).

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int61.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.ControlIn(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Requests arbitrary data from a USB device on the default control port.
member.param: A bitmap field for defining the USB control port request. The bitmap fields are defined by the USB specification. The direction bit must be device-to-host.
Request ID for this transfer. The meaning of this value depends on .
The requested value for this transfer.
The interface or endpoint index number, depending on .
The length of the data in bytes to send to the device during the Data stage. If this value is 0, then a zero-length byte array is returned from this method.
member.returns: The data received from the device.

remarks.para: The usage of each parameter is based on the relevant USB base or class specification, or on a vendor-specific request definition.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.ControlOut(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Sends arbitrary data to a USB device on the default control port.
member.param: A bitmap field for defining the USB control port request. The bitmap fields are defined by the USB specification. The direction bit must be host-to-device.
Request ID for this transfer. The meaning of this value depends on .
The requested value for this transfer.
The interface or endpoint index number, depending on .

remarks.para: The usage of each parameter is based on the relevant USB base or class specification, or on a vendor-specific request definition.

Since the USBTMC specification does not currently define any standard control port requests in the direction of host-to-device, this function is intended for use with only vendor-defined requests. However, this method does not check the requestType parameter for this.

The requested value for this transfer.
The interface or endpoint index number, depending on .
The data to send to the device during the Data stage.

member.summary: Controls the state of the USB REN interface line and, optionally, the remote/local state of the device.
member.param: The action to be taken with respect to the USB REN line.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.Interrupt
member.summary: Occurs when a vendor-specific USB interrupt is received from the device.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.Is4882Compliant
member.summary: If true, the device is IEEE 488.2 compliant.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.MaximumInterruptSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of bytes that this USB device will send on the interrupt IN pipe.

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used.The default value is the same as the maximum packet size of the interrupt IN pipe.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.ManufacturerId
member.summary: The USB vendor identification number of the hardware vendor for this device.

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.ManufacturerName
member.summary: The name of the hardware vendor that corresponds to the ManufacturerId property.

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.ModelCode

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used. The default is 0

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.ModelName
member.summary: The name of this device (corresponds to the ModelCode property).

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.UsbInterfaceNumber
member.summary: The USB interface number of the interface to which the USB device is connected.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 254, inclusive. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.UsbProtocol
member.summary: The USB protocol number.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.UsbSession.UsbSerialNumber

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.AsynchronousIOResult.Buffer
member.summary: The data buffer that contains the data to be written (for asynchronous writes) or the data read so far (for asynchronous reads).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.AsynchronousIOResult.Count
member.summary: The value of the count argument for the method call that created this VISA asynchronous results object. If the method did not include a count, then 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.AsynchronousIOResult.Index
member.summary: The value of the index argument for the method call that created this VISA asynchronous results object. If the method did not include an index, then 0.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.AsynchronousIOResult.IsAborted

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager
member.summary: Provides services related to general management of recognized I/O resources, including finding resources, parsing resource strings, opening I/O connections to resources, and providing general information about the Keysight VISA.NET implementation.
member.remarks:
Typically, there is only one active instance of the ResourceManager class. In a few cases, you may need two instances: one with FindExportedResourcesOnly true, and one with FindExportedResourcesOnly false.
For more information, see Resource Managers and the GRM.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of the ResourceManager class.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an instance of the ResourceManager class.
member.param: If true, only those resources with property ExportEnabled = true will be returned from viFindRsrc() and viParseRsrc(). The default value is false, which means that all resources will be returned regardless of the value of their ExportEnabled property. (Keysight Specific)

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.Finalize
member.summary: The default destructor for the ResourceManager class performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this instance of the resource manager.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.Dispose
member.summary: Performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this implementation of Keysight VISA.NET.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged VISA resources used by this implementation of Keysight VISA.NET, but only if another thread has not already started to dispose of this object.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Throws an exception if the object is already disposed.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Finds all of the VISA.NET resources that match the specified .
member.param: The search pattern.
member.returns: The list of resources matching the search .

remarks.para: Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of Find. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
The property determines whether Find will return all discovered instruments or just those that are marked as favorites. ReturnAll defaults to false, so that only favorites are returned.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.Open(System.String)

remarks.para: Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of Open. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, Open verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, Open does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.summary: Create a VISA I/O resource session.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed.

The timeout in milliseconds. This applies to the time taken to acquire the requested lock, and may also include the time needed to open a session to the resource. If the timeout is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), the method will not wait at all. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the method will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.ResourceManager.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a resource string to get extended interface information.
member.param: The VISA resource name.

remarks.para: This method should succeed for all strings returned by and recognized by Open.

The value returned in is, in most cases, identical to the canonical resource name. However, there may be cases where the canonical name includes information that the driver may not know until the resource has actually been opened. In these cases, the value returned will be semantically similar.

The value returned in allows programmatic access to user-defined aliases. Keysight VISA.NET recognizes aliases defined in the Keysight Connection Expert utility, which allows multiple aliases per resource. Parse returns the first alias it finds in the parse results. The ordering is not deterministic, so you should write your code to expect aliasIfExists to return any one of the defined aliases if multiple aliases exist.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all VXI BACKPLANE sessions.

remarks.para: VXI instrument vendors do not ordinarily expose the information needed to directly access a VXI instrument using registers. This information is cryptic and may change from firmware version to firmware version. Instead, vendors provide instrument drivers, software front panels, and other programs for instrument access. Under normal circumstances, instrument end users should not attempt to access VXI backplanes or instruments using this class.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a VxiBackplaneSession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and and infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a VxiBackplaneSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a VxiBackplaneSession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.MapTrigger(Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Maps the specified source trigger line to the specified destination trigger line.
member.param: The source trigger line.
The destination trigger line.

remarks.para: Mapping a trigger line (as either source or destination) multiple times requires special hardware capabilities and is not guaranteed to be implemented.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with the same source trigger line and different destination trigger lines, the result should be that when the source trigger line is asserted all specified destination trigger lines should also be asserted.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with different source trigger lines and the same destination trigger line the result should be that when any of the specified source trigger lines is asserted, the destination trigger line should also be asserted.
Mapping one trigger line to another modifies the state of hardware. Therefore, the effect continues beyond the scope of the VISA.NET session that mapped it, even if that VISA.NET session is closed.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.MapTrigger(Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Map the specified source trigger line to the specified destination trigger line.
member.param: The source trigger line.
The destination trigger line.
If true, the trigger has already been mapped.

remarks.para: Mapping a trigger line (as either source or destination) multiple times requires special hardware capabilities and is not guaranteed to be implemented.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with the same source trigger line and different destination trigger lines, the result should be that when the source trigger line is asserted all specified destination trigger lines should also be asserted.

If this operation is called multiple times on the same backplane resource with different source trigger lines and the same destination trigger line the result should be that when any of the specified source trigger lines is asserted, the destination trigger line should also be asserted.
Mapping one trigger line to another modifies the state of hardware. Therefore, the effect continues beyond the scope of the VISA.NET session that mapped it, even if that VISA.NET session is closed.

member.summary: Unmap the specified source trigger line.
member.param: The source trigger line.

remarks.para: This operation unmaps only one trigger mapping per call. If MapTrigger was called multiple times on the same backplane resource and created multiple mappings for the trigger source, trigger mappings other than the one specified by the trigger source remain in effect after this call completes.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.UnmapTrigger(Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine,Ivi.Visa.TriggerLine)
member.summary: Unmap the specified source trigger line from the specified destination trigger line.

The destination trigger line.

If MapTrigger was called multiple times on the same backplane resource and created multiple mappings for the trigger source, trigger mappings other than the one specified by the trigger source remain in effect after this call completes.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.Trigger
member.summary: Occurs when a trigger is received from the VXI backplane.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.
