member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.ChassisLogicalAddress
member.summary: The logical address of a given device in the mainframe (chassis), which serves as a unique ID for the mainframe.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 255, inclusive.

This is the logical address of a given device in the mainframe, usually the device with the lowest logical address. Other possible values include the logical address of the Slot 0 controller or of the parent-side extender. Often, these are all the same value.
Since the purpose of this attribute is to provide a unique ID for each mainframe, a VISA manufacturer can choose any of these values, but must be consistent across mainframes.
The value (-1) indicates that a chassis logical address cannot be determined.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.TriggerStatus
member.summary: The VXI trigger line(s) that are currently set.

remarks.para: All of the members defined in the enumeration are valid for VXI.
TriggerLines has the [Flags] attribute - multiple trigger lines may be specified by OR-ing them together.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.TriggerSupport
member.summary: The VXI trigger line(s) that this implementation supports.

remarks.para: All of the members defined in the enumeration are valid for VXI.
TriggerLines has the [Flags] attribute - multiple trigger lines may be specified by OR-ing them together.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.InterruptStatus
member.summary: The current state of the VXI/VME interrupt lines.

remarks.para: This is a bit vector with bits 0-6 corresponding to interrupt lines 1-7.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiBackplaneSession.SystemFailureStatus
member.summary: The current state of the VXI/VME SYSFAIL (SYStem FAILure) backplane line.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.VxiMemorySession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all VXI MEMACC sessions.

remarks.para: VXI instrument vendors do not ordinarily expose the information needed to directly access a VXI instrument using register-based communication. This information is cryptic and may change from one firmware version to the next. Instead, vendors provide instrument drivers, software front panels, and other programs for instrument access. Under normal circumstances, instrument end users should not attempt to access VXI instruments using this class.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiMemorySession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a VxiMemorySession class without any locking.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with and and infinite timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiMemorySession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a VxiMemorySession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the time span in milliseconds is 0, operations will never wait for the lock. If the time span is TimeSpan.MaxValue or the time span in milliseconds is greater than or equal to UInt32.MaxValue, the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative time spans are not valid.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiMemorySession.#ctor(System.String,Ivi.Visa.AccessModes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the operations necessary to instantiate a VxiMemorySession class.
member.param: The descriptor of the resource to which this class will be connected.

The modes by which the resource is to be accessed. ExclusiveLock is used to acquire an exclusive lock immediately upon opening a session. LoadConfig is used to configure attributes to values specified by some external configuration utility. The default in None.

If the accessMode parameter requests an exclusive lock, this parameter specifies the absolute time period (in milliseconds) that the constructor waits for a locked resource to be unlocked before throwing an exception, otherwise this parameter is ignored. If the value is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the lock. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the attempt to wait for the lock will never timeout. Negative values other than -1 are treated as unsigned values in the range between Int32.MaxValue and UInt32.MaxValue.

remarks.para: This constructor attempts to open a connection to the specified resource with the specified access modes and timeout.

Some Keysight IO Libraries Connection Expert settings and Keysight Instrument Discovery Service policies affect the operation of this constructor. Refer to the IO Libraries Suite Help for more details.
For instruments that are auto-discovered by the Discovery Service, the constructor verifies that the instrument is present.

For instruments that are manually-added, the constructor does not verify the presence of the instrument. If the device is not present or not turned on, you will not discover this until you attempt to communicate with the instrument.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiMemorySession.Move(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,Ivi.Visa.DataWidth,Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,Ivi.Visa.DataWidth,System.Int64)
member.summary: Moves data from the specified source to the specified destination.
member.param: The address space of the source.
The offset (in bytes) of the memory from which data is moved.
The data width of the source.
The address space of the destination.
The offset (in bytes) of the memory to which data is moved.
The data width of the destination.
The number of elements to move, where the data width of the elements to move is identical to the source data width.

remarks.para: The offset parameters are absolute offsets from the start of memory in the specified VXI address space.

This method operates successfully independently from "low-level" memory operations defined in the class (PeekXX, PokeXX). The operations are independent regardless of the configured state of the hardware that is used to perform memory accesses.

The parameter is the number of elements (of the size corresponding to the operation) to transfer, beginning at the specified offset. Therefore, offset + (count * size) cannot exceed the amount of memory exported by the device in the given space.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiMemorySession.LogicalAddress
member.summary: The logical address of the VXI or VME controller for this interface.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 255, inclusive.

member.name: T:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession
member.summary: An instantiable class that supports all VXI INSTR sessions.

remarks.para: The VxiSession class supports both register-based communication, and message-based communication (for instruments that support it). In general, message-based communication is recommended for instrument end users, and register-based communication is not.

VXI instrument vendors do not ordinarily expose the information needed to directly access a VXI instrument using register-based communication. This information is cryptic and may change from one firmware version to the next. Instead, vendors provide either a message-based alternative or some form of programmatic access via instrument drivers, software front panels, and so on. Under normal circumstances, instrument end users should not attempt to access VXI instruments using register-based communication.
Methods and properties that implement register-based properties are marked "[Register-Based]" in the documentation, including Intellisense.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MapAddress(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: [Register-Based] Maps the specified memory space into this processs address space.
member.param: Specifies the address space to map.
Offset (in bytes) of the memory to be mapped.
Amount of memory to map (in bytes).
member.returns: A reference to the IMemoryMap interface, which provides the ability to Peek and Poke mapped memory.

remarks.para: You can only have one map at a time for a given session. If you need to have multiple maps to a device, you must open one session for each map needed.
The mapBase parameter is the offset address relative to the device's allocated address base for the corresponding address space specified.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MoveIn8(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: [Register-Based] Moves an 8-bit block of data from the specified memory space (assigned memory base + offset) to local memory.
member.param: The address space.
The offset (in bytes) of the address or register from which bytes are moved.
The number of elements to transfer.
member.returns: The data read from the bus.

remarks.para: If the session is an instrument (INSTR) session, the offset parameter specifies a relative offset from the start of the instruments address space. If the session is a memory access (MEMACC) session, the offset parameter is an absolute offset from the start of memory in the specified address space.
All operations on a PXI memory access session that accept a space parameter to indicate the address space for bus access will accept the value AddressSpace.PxiAllocation.

The count parameter is the number of 8-bit elements to transfer, beginning at the specified offset. Therefore, (offset + count) cannot exceed the amount of memory exported by the device in the given space.

member.summary: [Register-Based] Moves a 32-bit block of data from local (source) memory to the specified destination memory space (assigned memory base + offset).

The offset (in bytes) of the destination starting address or register to which data from is moved.
The data to move to the destination.

remarks.para: If the session is an instrument (INSTR) session, the offset parameter specifies a relative offset from the start of the instruments address space. If the session is a memory access (MEMACC) session, the offset parameter is an absolute offset from the start of memory in the specified address space.
All operations on a PXI memory access session that accept a space parameter to indicate the address space for bus access will accept the value AddressSpace.PxiAllocation.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MoveOut32(Ivi.Visa.AddressSpace,System.Int64,System.Int32[],System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: [Register-Based] Moves a 32-bit block of data from local (source) memory to the specified destination memory space (assigned memory base + offset).
member.param: The address space.
The offset (in bytes) of the destination starting address or register to which data from is moved.
The data to move to the destination, starting at and moving bytes.
The starting index in of the bytes to move
The number of bytes to move.

remarks.para: If the session is an instrument (INSTR) session, the offset parameter specifies a relative offset from the start of the instruments address space. If the session is a memory access (MEMACC) session, the offset parameter is an absolute offset from the start of memory in the specified address space.
All operations on a PXI memory access session that accept a space parameter to indicate the address space for bus access will accept the value AddressSpace.PxiAllocation.

The count parameter is the number of 32-bit elements to transfer, beginning at the specified sourceIndex. Therefore, sourceIndex + sourceBuffer.Length*4 cannot exceed the amount of memory exported by the device in the given space.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.AssertTrigger(Ivi.Visa.VxiTriggerProtocol)
member.summary: Assert a software or hardware trigger.
member.param: The trigger protocol to use when the trigger is asserted.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.CommandQuery(Ivi.Visa.VxiCommandMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the device a miscellaneous command or query and/or retrieves the response to a previous query.
member.param: Indicates whether to issue a command and/or retrieve a response, and the type or size of the command or response.
The command to send.
member.returns: The response retrieved from the device. If the mode does not include a response, this method returns zero.

remarks.para: If the mode parameter specifies sending a 16-bit command, the upper half of the command parameter is ignored. If the mode parameter specifies just retrieving a response, the command parameter is ignored. If the mode parameter specifies sending a command only, the return value may be 0. If a response is retrieved but is only a 16-bit value, the upper half of the return value will be set to 0.
Refer to the VXI Specification for defined word serial commands. The command values Byte Available, Byte Request, Clear, and Trigger are not valid for this operation.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemoryAllocate(System.Int64)
member.summary: [Register-Based] Keysight VISA.NET does not support this method.
member.param: The size of the allocated memory in bytes
member.returns: The offset of the allocated device memory.
member.remarks: This is a standard method to allocate memory from the devices memory region, but it is not supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

member.name: M:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemoryFree(System.Int64)
member.summary: [Register-Based] Keysight VISA.NET does not support this method.
member.param: The offset of the allocated device memory.
member.remarks: This is a standard method to free previously allocated memory, but it is not supported by Keysight VISA.NET.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.AllowDma
member.summary: [Register-Based] Specifies whether direct memory access is enabled.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.DestinationIncrement
member.summary: [Register-Based] For MoveOut methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.

remarks.para: For MoveOutXX methods, this property specifies how much the destination offset will be incremented after every transfer.
The default value of this attribute is 1, indicating that the destination address will be incremented by 1 after each transfer, so that items are moved into consecutive elements.
If this property is set to 0, the MoveOutXX method will always write to the same element, essentially treating the destination as a FIFO register.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.SourceIncrement
member.summary: [Register-Based] For MoveIn methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.

remarks.para: For MoveInXX methods, this property specifies how much the source offset will be incremented after every transfer.
The default value of this attribute is 1, indicating that the source address will be incremented by 1 after each transfer, so that items are moved from consecutive elements.
If this property is set to 0, the MoveInXX methods will always read from the same element, essentially treating the source as a FIFO register.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.Interrupt
member.summary: Occurs when a VXIbus interrupt is received from the device.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: E:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.SignalProcessor
member.summary: Occurs when a VXIbus signal or VXIbus interrupt is received from the device.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

remarks.para: Multiple event handlers may be registered for this event.

When a calling program registers an event handler, it is possible that the event handler might be called before the call to register the event handler returns. In this case, the event handlers registered for an event are executed before the return of the event handler registration.

Client programs should either use the event-related methods , , , and VisaSession.WaitOnEvent (any overload) with the appropriate eventType, -or- the .NET events which are defined individually for each event stype in the ession class to which they apply. If a calling program uses both mechanisms at the same time, it will receive the event twice, once for each mechanism.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.CommanderLogicalAddress
member.summary: The logical address of the commander of the VXI device used by the given session.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 255, inclusive. The value -1 indicates that the logical address is unknown.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.DestinationAccessPrivilege
member.summary: [Register-Based] The address modifier used in high-level access methods, such as OutXX() and MoveOutXX(), when writing to the destination.

remarks.para: The default is DataPrivileged.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.DestinationByteOrder
member.summary: [Register-Based] The destination address space byte order used in high-level access methods, such as OutXX() and MoveOutXX(), when writing to the destination.

remarks.para: The default is BigEndian.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.DeviceClass
member.summary: The VXI-defined device class to which the resource belongs.

remarks.para: VME devices are usually either register based (Register) or belong to a miscellaneous class (Other).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.FastDataChannelNumber
member.summary: [Register-Based] The FDC channel that will be used when transferring data.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 7, inclusive.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.FastDataChannelUseStreaming
member.summary: [Register-Based] If true, FDC streaming will be used when transferring data (Normal mode or Stream mode).

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.FastDataChannelUsePair
member.summary: [Register-Based] If true, a channel pair will be used when transferring data, rather than a single channel.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.Is4882Compliant
member.summary: If true, the device is IEEE 488.2 compliant.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.IsImmediateServant
member.summary: If true, the device is an immediate servant of the controller running VISA.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.LogicalAddress
member.summary: The logical address of the VXI or VME device used by the given session.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 511, inclusive.
For a VME device, the logical address is actually a pseudo-address in the range 256 to 511.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.ChassisLogicalAddress
member.summary: The logical address of a given device in the mainframe, which serves as a unique ID for the mainframe.

remarks.para: The range is between 0 and 255, inclusive.

This is the logical address of a given device in the mainframe, usually the device with the lowest logical address. Other possible values include the logical address of the Slot 0 controller or of the parent-side extender. Often, these are all the same value.
Since the purpose of this attribute is to provide a unique ID for each mainframe, a VISA manufacturer can choose any of these values, but must be consistent across mainframes.
The value VxiUnknownLogicalAddress (-1) indicates that a chassis logical address cannot be determined.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.ManufacturerId
member.summary: The VXIbus vendor identification number of the hardware vendor for this device.

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.ManufacturerName
member.summary: The name of the hardware vendor that corresponds to the property.

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemoryMapAccessPrivilege
member.summary: [Register-Based] The address modifier to be used in operations when accessing the mapped window.

remarks.para: The default is DataPrivileged.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemoryMapByteOrder
member.summary: [Register-Based] The byte order to be used in operations when accessing the mapped window.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemoryBase
member.summary: [Register-Based] The base address of the device in VXIbus memory address space.

remarks.para: The base address is applicable to A24 or A32 address space.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemorySize
member.summary: [Register-Based] The size of the memory requested by the device in the VXIbus address space.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.MemorySpace
member.summary: [Register-Based] The VXIbus address space used by the device.

remarks.para: The default is AddressSpace.VxiA16.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.ModelCode
member.summary: The vendor-specific model number for this VXIbus device.

remarks.para: The range is between Int16.MinValue and Int16.MaxValue, inclusive. Negative values are converted to unsigned integers between Int16.MaxValue + 1 and UInt16.MaxValue before they are used. The default is 0

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.ModelName
member.summary: The name of this device (corresponds to the property).

remarks.para: When using multiple implementations of VISA.NET from different vendors, the value of this attribute should be used for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions, as the value can be different between VISA implementations and/or revisions.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.Slot
member.summary: The physical slot location of this VXIbus device. If the location is not known, this property returns UnknownSlotNumber.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.SourceAccessPrivilege
member.summary: [Register-Based] The address modifier to be used in high-level access methods, such as InXX() and MoveInXX(), when reading from the source.

remarks.para: The default is DataPrivileged.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.SourceByteOrder
member.summary: [Register-Based] The source address space byte order.

remarks.para: The default is BigEndian.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.TriggerLine
member.summary: The current triggering line.

remarks.para: All of the triggers in the TriggerLine enumeration may be used with VXI triggers.

member.name: P:Keysight.Visa.VxiSession.TriggerSupport
member.summary: The VXI trigger line(s) that this implementation supports.

remarks.para: Multiple triggers may be specified.
All of the triggers in the TriggerLines enumeration may be used with VXI triggers.
